column4: can someone help with my dell inprion 1300 and dell mini-pci card i have used ndiswrapper and it works fine the hardware is present and so is the driver but i still cant get it to detect the card for some reseon it works fine on xp
why is it not working on ubuntu then
because the vendor is a nasty type who wont suuport linux and release tech docs so a proper opensource driver can be written
i read on the forum that dell does something to the card to make sure it only turns on when dell turns on could this be true
i dont understand what you mean
someone said that dell made the card so it turns it self on with xp
it just has a working driver
anyway ,, another time ,, go for a thinkpad t or x .. they have exceptional linux support
why does ndiswrapper not work i have did it correctly i got the drivers from dell \
beats me ,, maybe ndiswrapper isnt as good as you think it is
native driver confuse me i got one but dont know what to do with it
well a native driver would be one thats actually made to drive your device on the "native" os ,, that is,, in this case linux
have no idea,, im a hardware freak ,, i only buy hardware i know linux has native drivers for
sure,, but there  must be guides on google
you could search for your laptop on tuxmobile.org or linuxonlaptops
its very easy to build a new kernel
